contentrichtext.text: A '''nanoring''' is a small ringformed crystal. The first nanoring made was a [[zinc oxide]] nanoring discovered by researchers at [[Georgia Institute of Technology]].<ref>{{cite journal |author=Kong XY, Ding Y, Yang R, Wang ZL |title=Single-crystal nanorings formed by epitaxial self-coiling of polar nanobelts |journal=Science |volume=303 |issue=5662 |pages=1348–51 |year=2004 |month=February |pmid=14988559 |doi=10.1126/science.1092356}}</ref> They are made by a spontaneous self-coiling process of [[nanobelt]]s. Many layers of nanobelts are rolled together as coils, layer-by-layer. ==References== {{reflist}} ==Further reading== *{{cite journal |author = Wang, Z.L. |year = 2004 |title = Nanostructures of zinc oxide |journal = Materials Today |volume = 7 |issue = 6 |pages = 26–33 |doi = 10.1016/S1369-7021(04)00286-X}} ==External links== *[http://gtresearchnews.gatech.edu/newsrelease/nanorings.htm Nanorings: Seamless Circular Structures Could be Sensors, Resonators and Transducers for Nanoelectronics & Biotechnology] ([http://www.nanotechnology.com/news/?id=4318 alternative link]) {{chem-stub}} [[Category:Nanomaterials]]
